Yes, there are many responsible and sustainable tourism companies and destinations in Asia that prioritize the protection of marine life. Here are a few recommendations:

1. El Nido Resorts, Palawan, Philippines: This resort group has implemented several initiatives to conserve marine ecosystems such as coral reefs, seagrass beds, and mangroves. Guests can enjoy various activities such as beach cleanups, educational tours, and snorkeling tours that are designed to promote awareness of sustainable practices.

2. Scuba Junkie, Sabah, Malaysia: This dive center has implemented several conservation projects focused on sea turtles, shark conservation, and coral reefs. Guests are welcomed to participate in these projects, and the center works with local communities to promote responsible fishing practices.

3. Misool, Raja Ampat, Indonesia: This remote diving resort is committed to protecting and preserving the Raja Ampat archipelago, one of the most biodiverse marine ecosystems in the world. The resort offers various conservation programs, including shark tagging and coral restoration projects.

4. Andaman Discoveries, Phang Nga, Thailand: This community-based tourism organization offers responsible tourism activities that promote sustainable practices and protect marine life. They work with local communities to support conservation initiatives, including mangrove planting and sea turtle conservation.

These are just a few options for responsible and sustainable tourism companies and destinations in Asia that prioritize the protection of marine life. As always, it’s important to do your own research before booking. Look for companies and destinations that prioritize conservation, provide education on sustainable practices, and work with local communities to promote responsible use of marine resources.
